topic: How to implement event-driven systems using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to implement event-driven systems using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Implementing Event-Driven Systems Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to create an event-driven system using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI supports asynchronous handling of multiple requests concurrently
It uses TypeScript for better type checking and autocompletion
FastAPI provides automatic JSON response, validation, and documentation
Event-driven architecture allows the system to react in real-time to external events

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI
app = FastAPI()

def on_event(event: Event):
    ...
app.on_event("example_event", on_event)

version_notes: Ensure your environment is using this version of FastAPI for compatibility with Python 3.12
caveats: Event-driven systems can be complex, requiring good understanding of asynchronous programming and event handling
FastAPI provides an Event class but does not handle event loops or brokers out-of-the-box, so you'll need additional libraries for that
